Fields.DialogueText: *stretches*
Nothing better after a successful mission than some downtime, right?
I guess.

Fields.MenuText: Someone doesn't sound too happy.
Don't tell me... you hate downtime.
Do you want me to ignore you or keep poking you until you tell me?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not. I'm bored.
No, really? What was your first clue?
You better not ignore me. I'm working so hard to sulk over here.
I just don't think that we deserve a break, is all. That mission was way too easy. I'm ready for the next one.
Has anyone ever told you to be careful what you wish for?
Nope, I can honestly say I've never been told that.
Really? That's actually surprising. With your personality, you should be hearing it constantly.
Rude. And up until a little while ago, I was a ship. That's not really something people say to ships. But, I bet you've never had a bottle broken on your head.
You got me there.
Thought so. Now can we take a break from this break and find some Morganas to trounce.
I guess that's better than getting rusty.
@BATTLE
Admiral, I've been looking for you. You're a hard man to find.
I actually pride myself on my stealthiness, Captain. What did you need?
A new mission.
You just finished your last one. Enjoy the break.

Fields.MenuText: I would, but St. Louis is getting antsy.
Our last mission was a little too easy. It doesn't feel like we deserve a break.
Break, shmake, we need something to do.

Fields.DialogueText: Why am I not surprised? I understand.
You don't feel like you deserve a break? Someone needs to work on valuing themselves.
Ha, it sounds like St. Louis is rubbing off on you.
Let me guess, St. Louis asked you to talk to me?
Actually no, I just know that if I didn't ask you, she'd probably make a scene.
Hey, there you are! Give me something to do!
Speak of the devil, we were just talking about you.
You calling me a devil?
That wouldn't be very smart of me, now would it? We were just talking about getting you a new mission. I was just telling your captain here that it'll take just a little bit longer.
*groan* Just make it quick and make it awesome.
Will do. Now why don't you go help her find something to do, or something to fight.
Good idea.
@BATTLE
Captain, have I got some good news for you.
I hope that means you've got a mission for us. St. Louis has been threatening to revolt. It's actually kind of adorable.
Adorable? I usually get more of a tiny terror vibe from her.
My ears were burning. Should I be involved in this conversation?
Yikes, where did you come from?!
I hear my name and I come running. I'm just kind of awesome that way. What's going on?
We have a new mission.
Seriously? Finally! I've been sitting on my hands for so long that I can't even feel them anymore. See? They're all numb and stuff!
Hopefully you can still use your hands well enough to go through your new mission.
Ooh, a manila folder. Very official.
Anything short of dragons in here, and I'mma be disappointed.
I think you'll be happy. You're going to Hawaii.
Hawaii?

Fields.MenuText: What's the catch?
Fantastic! I could really go for some fun in the sun.
This won't be fun. I don't really tan well.

Fields.DialogueText: The catch is we gotta go to hawaii. There's nothing less exciting than a vacation spot.
Fun in the sun? We're not going to find any dragons getting a tan.
I'm right there with you. Then again, I'm just not sure I vacation well.
You're complaining about getting an assignment in Hawaii?
Mhmmm, that's right. Are you really so surprised?
Kind of yeah.
You really don't want to go?
Well, I don't want to, but it's better than just sitting here. I guess...
Think you might be able to find something a little more... adventurous for us?
Now you're teaming up against me? Fine... I'll see what I can do. No promises though.
Really? If you find something awesome, I'll give you a big hug!
Despite that, I'll still do my best. Now, make yourselves useful and run a patrol or something.
Yes, Admiral!
@BATTLE
All right, I think I've found a compromise that will make everyone happy.
I wouldn't expect dragons if I were you, St. Louis.
I know, I know... Doesn't stop me from hoping though.
Well, it's not dragons---
Dangit!
I've been informed that there's a number of Morgana subs that have been causing problems for trade.
Where they've been attacking is a bit out of the way, but you should be able to swing by and take care of them on your way to Hawaii.
So we still have to go to Hawaii?

Fields.MenuText: Hey, you wanted an adventure, right? Sounds like an adventure to me.
Stop complaining, Hawaii ain't that bad.
Still thinking about revolting?

Fields.DialogueText: You've got a point. It does sound more exciting now.
Have you ever even been there before?
Hmmm, no, I guess I'm okay with this. For now.
If we've got to go to Hawaii, at least we get to go on an epic hunt for Morgana subs before we get there. I'm good to go, Captain.
Well, you might want to make sure everything is stocked before you head out.
That's so like you, Admiral. Where's your sense of wonder? Heading off into the unknown without looking back! Now, that's how you start an adventure.
*ALARM*
The problem is that the "unknown" is filled with Morganas. I don't know about you, but I'd rather not run out of ammo while fighting them.
Exactly right, Captain.
Fair enough. I see your point.
@BATTLE
Have you?
No, because it sucks.
Why do you think the Admiral is sending us to Hawaii, huh? You think I did something to piss him off? Maybe he just sees me as a big annoyance and this is how he gets rid of me.
St. Louis, you know that most people would think of an assignment to Hawaii as a reward, right?
Well, I guess I'm not like most people. It's just going to be a bunch of busy work and blah.
I'm not so sure about that. The Hawaiian Islands are a U.S. territory, but they're so far from the mainland, that it's got to be a huge target for our enemies.
I guess... I never thought about that. You really think we could be defending against some huge attack or something?

Fields.MenuText: I'd hope not. Let's stop talking about this. We don't wanna jinx it.
It's a definite possibility. Don't let your guard down, St. Louis.
Honestly? Probably not. I mean, what are the odds?

Fields.DialogueText: Would jinxing it make it happen or not happen? Because I want it to happen.
Oooh, you're getting me all pumped up now, Captain. This might be more fun than I thought.
I'm not sure, but odds are usually on my side, you know, Captain.
Okay, I'm feeling a lot better about this new assignment. Think we're good to start moving out?
Everything's looking shipshape actually.
Captain, that's not even funny. Don't say that anymore, please.
I thought it was a little funny.
Let's just agree to disagree and get out on the open ocean. It's calling for us.
@BATTLE
Hey, St. Louis, I just wanted to tell you that you're doing a great job out there.
Uh, thanks... you don't have to pat my head like I'm a kid though.
It's just a sign of appreciation. Nothing more. See?
Wait a minute! I see what you're doing! I thought I put an end to all this.
What are you talking about? It's just an innocent headpat.
You're trying to rub me for luck. I'm not a rabbit's foot, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: But what if it works?
I don't know what you're talking about. I just wanted to pat your head. Honestly.
Okay, I'll admit it. I'll stop if it's making you that upset.

Fields.DialogueText: Just makes the affection feel kinda fake...
Really? I wish I could believe that, but I just can't.
I'd appreciate that.
It wasn't that long ago that the entire crew was treating me like some lucky charm. I don't know how many times I had to shout at them, but they finally let off.
Not as much as you might think. They still talk about how you have more luck than a four leaf clover.
Yeah, well at least they're not trying to make keychains out of my hair. Any more.
Okay, I promise I'll treat you like a normal girl, okay?
Well, I wouldn't exactly say I'm normal.
You're not, you're extraordinary.
Heh, yeah, I am, ain't I?
And extraordinary girls get headpats.
Is it really so much fun to pat my head?!
Yes, and not because you're a good luck charm. It's mostly because of your reaction.
How am I supposed to react when you keep messing with me like this!
Heh, so adorable.
@BATTLE
Hey, do you think planes have spirits too?
What?
I mean, like, Belles are the spirits of warships, do you think there are spirits in other things too?

Fields.MenuText: That kind of came out of the blue there, St. Louis.
I'm not so sure. It sounds a little crazy to me.
Could be. It doesn't sound any more farfetched than everything else I've seen.

Fields.DialogueText: Not really. I've been thinking about it for a while.
Crazier than Morganas eating ships and plaguing the seas?
You say that like you've seen everything.
I wish I was a plane instead of a ship.
I'm happy you're a ship. Our whole crew wouldn't fit in an itty-bitty plane.
Well, we wouldn't need a whole crew. We could just fly right over the sea from coast to coast. Just you and me.
Really want to be stuck with me in close quarters like that?
Could be nice, Captain... You and me for a little bit, don'tcha think?
But if I was a plane, we could just fly right over these Morganas.
I'll give you that one.
@BATTLE
Thinking and saying are two different things.
You make a fair point.
No. No way. I'm still waiting for the day I can listen to the radio on the go.
Uh... *cough* and we could still smash up Morganas when we got back!
Guess the world isn't running out of them any time soon.
*ALARM*
Okay, here we are. Where are these subs that are causing all the trouble?
I'm not sure... We're definitely in the right place, but it sure seems quiet.
You think they saw me coming and got so afraid that they ran with their Morgana tails between their legs?

Fields.MenuText: That has to be it.
Or maybe they're about to strike... NOW!
They are subs. They could be here right now, lying in wait.

Fields.DialogueText: Heheh, just the sight of The Great St. Louis is enough to send lesser Morganas running home to their ugly mommies!
Oooh, how cool would it have been if they had actually attacked on your cue. That would've been amazing!
Some dummy Morganas holding their breath and hiding. Maybe we should shoot some torpedoes or something just in case.
Check the charts again. Verify our coordinates, maybe?
No way, this is it. They're just not here.
*ALARM*
Is it the subs?
No, Captain, we're picking up a small group of Morganas on approach from the south. You can see them on the horizon.
Well, look at that. Not the subs we were looking for, but they're better than nothing.
We'll worry about our targets later. Let's just take care of this threat first.
Yeah, that's pretty much what I said. Let's go!
@BATTLE
Captain, that last fight took more out of us than expected.
How did we get so banged up? I thought we were handling them fine.
It had to be those sneaky little subs. They came out in the middle of the fight and took pot shots at us. No fair!
That actually seems pretty likely.
What do you mean "likely?"
Check with engineering. I want our damage control to check everything again.
Right away, Captain.
What are you talking about? We gotta stay and scoop up those sneaky jerks before they hide again.

Fields.MenuText: I don't want to end up underwater with them.
We're running low on ammo. If we're going to fight an enemy we can't see, let's at least do it with as much ammo as we can carry.
If you really think we can take them on now, we'll stay, but think about it for a minute.

Fields.DialogueText: All the easier to shoot them.
I would like to unload a hail of shells and torpedoes on them.
So you want me to stop and think before I act? Okay, this is new for me. I'll give it a shot...
I guess you've got a point. Let's get out of here.
But you haven't seen the last of us, you sneaky little shrimp!
*ahem* Captain... *ahem*
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
If my Captain wasn't hold me back right now! I'd make you all-- *ahem*
What?
Get your arms around me, like you're holding me back from punching the Morganas...
Oh - like this?
Mmm... yeah... that's nice, actually...
*ahem* You're not safe, you scared little Morganas! I'm gonna get you!
At least somebody came out to play! Let's bust 'em up, Captain!
Okay, Captain. You can let go of me... for now.
Right.
St. Louis, I'm coming in, hope you're decent.
Wait, wait, stop, ah, ugh! *tumbles and crashes*
I uh, just wanted to let you know we reached port. We should be good to go shortly.
That's great news! Thanks for letting me know. Now leave. Go away!
Hmmm, before I do that... would you like to tell me why you're trying to hide that massive portrait behind you? I mean, who even is that? Should I be jealous or something?
Everyone should be jealous! That's Charles Lindbergh, he's not just some guy, that's THE guy.

Fields.MenuText: I might regret asking you this, but who's Charles Lindbergh?
I'm actually more curious about how you got such a massive poster.
And here I was walking around thinking I was the guy.

Fields.DialogueText: It's like you don't know anything important. Not only is he dreamy, but he's the first man to fly nonstop across the Atlantic. And guess what he flew in. A plane named The Spirit of St. Louis. Boom.
Why? Do you have someone you want a giant photograph of on your wall? Maybe me? I wouldn't blame you, I'm so adorable.
Please, you're not even close to the anything. You gotta work a little harder if you want that legendary status.
Now, if you would please leave and give me a moment to cover all this up, I'd greatly appreciate it.
Okay, I don't really understand why you've got to hide it, but whatever.
It's a secret crush. Now go, scat!
Yeah, cuz that's what you do with secrets. Tell me about them before you hide them.
*ALARM*
Great, looks like they couldn't give us a little time to rest. Think you'll be ready to join us for the fight?
I'm hurrying, just give me a second!
Fine, spend all the time you need with your secret boyfriend. I'll just be fighting Morganas in the meantime.
He he heh, you sound jealous.
I sound like I'm fighting Morganas!
@BATTLE
And we're back.
They're probably already aiming to take us down when we least expect it.
Don't you worry about that, Captain. I've got this.

Fields.MenuText: You seem pretty confident. I'll leave it to you then.
You've got this? What exactly do you got?
Oh, I know that look. Nothing good can come from that look.

Fields.DialogueText: Smart move. With my plan, we're guaranteed to win.
I've got a plan. It's full-proof. Or, wait... is it full-proof or fool-proof? Eh, it can be both.
Oh, come on. I've got a really good plan. I've been working on it since we left port.
So what is this plan of yours?
Hmmm... Let's see... Let's... fire there.
What?
Fire there. Where I'm pointing. That's probably most definitely where the Morganas are hiding.
You can't know that.
Call it... a lucky guess.
All right... you hear her. Fire a torpedo.
Or a few. Trust me, we'll hit.
Fire a few then! Happy?
You will be too in a second.
*BOOM*
That's--- A Morgana just surfaced!
I told you we'd hit.
That was the luckiest shot in the world. I thought you didn't think you were lucky.
I'm not some luck charm for people to rub, but I might have a good helping of luck on my side.
Well, hopefully it'll still be on your side for this fight. I doubt that's the only sub nearby. We gotta be careful.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I'm here. How many of them are there and how close are they?
A bunch, and just over there.
Fair enough.
@BATTLE
That's the last of 'em! I think we handled that pretty nicely, don't you?

Fields.MenuText: We could've taken care of it a little faster, but overall, good job.
I was very impressed. Good job, St. Louis.
Seriously? I'm pretty sure I saw my life flash before my eyes there!

Fields.DialogueText: Faster shmaster! You can't rush a good adventure!
Thanks, Cap. I know I'm awesome, but it's nice to hear you say it every once in a while.
Oh, don't be such a baby. You were perfectly safe. Even when that missile almost went off in your face.
So, now that that's done, you ready to make our way to Hawaii?
Oh, Hawaii! I totally forgot about that!
You got that distracted, huh?
I wasn't distracted, I was focused.
You're not going to throw a fit again are you?
About going to Hawaii? Nah, I'll go, begrudgingly. I still expect to be fending off more beachballs than bombs.
We can only hope.
I didn't say you were awesome.
Sure, but that's what you meant. *wink*
Maybe.
Hey, so what specifically is our mission in Hawaii?
You sound like a girl who hasn't read the file.
I started to. But then it got boring. And I mean real boring. I took a nap instead.

Fields.MenuText: How far did you get?
Well, then I guess you didn't get to the part about the dragon slaying leprechaun we're hunting on the island of Dodongolua.
You're lucky you're cute.

Fields.DialogueText: First paragraph. It lost me with all the big words. And I know big words, I like big words, but these were big boring words.
I wish! Now that would be an exciting mission. But I know there are no such things as leprechauns. And a dragon would eat one in an instant anyway.
Are you trying to flatter me or was that an insult?
Apparently there's a little worry about an increase of Morganas in the area. We're supposed to patrol the islands and dispatch any we come across. After a while we'll get called back.
So it's like an indefinite vacation? Yeah, no wonder reading about it didn't catch my interest.
Who knows? Maybe if you kept reading you'd find something interesting about the assignment.
I'd rather read Twain, thank you very much. That's an author that knows how to keep my interest.
Mark Twain?
No, Terry Twain, the other famous Twain author... Yes Mark Twain.
You're cute when you're all uppity.
... See, I wanna get "uppity" now, but I don't want to give you the satisfaction.
*ALARM*
Let's just take care of the Morganas then.
@BATTLE
A little of both.
Captain, we've got a problem.
What is it? More Morganas?
No... but if we were to run into Morganas right now, that might be an even bigger problem.
What are you talking about?
He's talkin's 'bout meeeeee! *tumble* Oh, crap, mah knee! Ohhhhhh, ouch.

Fields.MenuText: What's wrong with her?
Is she sick or something?
Oh my god, you are the most adorable little drunk.

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing, I'm perfect. And bored, really bored. Not so much anymore though. Hehehe.
I don't... Yeah, I don't think I've ever gotten sick... Nope. I think I'd remember it. I guess I'm just lucky... I guess.
Hey, I... I don't know what... No. You are.
She got into the lager we picked up in Germany. She downed six bottles in the galley before anyone noticed her.
Six entire bottles?
I was celebrating! We beat up all those nasty subs, didn't we?
As cute as this is, I think we should lock up the rest.
Who said *burp* cute? Was that you, Cap? You're... you're the cute one. Lemme pat your cute- *tumble*
Woah, head rush.
I guess you should hide it too then. And we'll just cross our fingers and hope we avoid any Morganas until she can sober up.
Morganas? I heard Morganas! I'm coming Morganas!
@BATTLE
Awww, who's the cutest drunk? Who's the cutest drunk.
Heh, I am.
Hey, St. Louis, do you see what I see?
Shhhhh. I'm resting my everything.
Head still throbbing? The first hangover is the worst.
Mhmmmm. *softly* Now... if you could get me a blanket and some crackers and just softly stroke my head... that'd be good.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, I was just going to point out the horizon, but if you're not interested...
As fun as that sounds I think you might want to open your eyes for just one second.
But what about Hawaii?

Fields.DialogueText: Wait, what's that about the horizon? Describe it to me, I can't look, it's too bright.
I have a better idea. You should close your eyes, and we should just take a nap on deck in the warm sun and stop talking.
Hawaii? Are we there? I could really use some R&R right about now.
Just squint toward the horizon and tell me what you see.
Ehhhh, the sun it blinding me... Is that land? Are we coming up to it, or is it coming up to us?
We should be there before you know it.
The first thing I'm doing there is finding us a nice palm tree to nap under. Just you and me and nobody bothering us.
That's pretty unlike you, St. Louis.
Then when we wake up, I'm gonna find me my dragon.
That's more like it.
@BATTLE
St. Louis? We've been expecting you.
Yeah, we had to take a little detour, but we're here now.
You don't gotta worry too much about Morganas with us around.
Well, we haven't had to worry too much regardless. I don't know where this fear of attack is coming from, but I guess it's better safe than sorry.
... You don't look Hawaiian.
Excuse her. What she lacks in tact she makes up for in adorability.
It's fine, I'm not. I'm from Minnesota. Though I've been stationed here for the better part of a year now, I'd say.
And no Morgana attacks?
Only a handful.
Oh dammit, this is going to be so boooooring!

Fields.MenuText: Don't mind her, she's just... She's St. Louis.
I thought you wanted a little boring.
I'm not disagreeing, but shhhhh, rude!

Fields.DialogueText: By that he means I'm the best Belle in all the fleet. Wanna see what I can do with a coin? Watch this!
A little bit of boring. Not a buffet of boring served 24-7.
I'm St. Louis. I'm rude. Live with it!
Well, you two are certainly interesting. If nothing more you'll add a little more color to our patrol.
*ALARM*
Speaking of, it sounds like that's a Morgana now.
I hope there are more where that one came from.
@BATTLE
Just ignore her. She'll keep herself busy with that coin all day.
I see someone's getting comfortable with the island life.
I guess it has its perks.
I've never actually sunbathed before. It's kinda fun.

Fields.MenuText: You've never sunbathed before? What are you afraid of daylight or something?
Well, be careful not to burn, wouldn't want to mess up that tan.
Maybe I'll find some time to join you soon.

Fields.DialogueText: I never had a chance, before. Don't be so insensitive, Captain. You're not a Belle. You don't know.
Psh, I doubt I'll tan. Though... I bet I'd look good with a tan. Hmmm...
That would be okay. I'll lay a towel out for you so it'll be nice and toasty when you're ready.
Oh, that's right, before I forget, I was hoping you could do me a favor.
Sure, what do you need?
I heard about a luau they were having on the beach, and I was hoping we could maybe get close enough that I might be able to join in. What do you think?
I mean, I can try, but I'm not sure how close would be too close, ya know?
I understand. We'll find out later. Now let's kill some time with Morgana patrol.
@BATTLE
... I can't believe we couldn't get closer. It's like torture being able to watch and not join in.
Hey, St. Louis, I picked you up something special.
Is that food? Whoa, it smells delicious. Is all that for me?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, if you think you can eat all of it.
Well, I was actually hoping we could share, but if you're that hungry have at it.
No.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, trust me, I can eat a my body weight. And I mean the weight of the ship.
No, no, I mean, I am, but we can share if you want to.
Rude sonuva--
I figured since I couldn't get you to the luau that I could try and bring some of it to you.
That's... thanks a lot, Cap. It really brings a tear... to my stomach, I'm starving! Gimme!
Hey, hey, here you go, just don't eat my hand.
As long as you get your hand out of my pig, there will be no bloodshed.
Heh, deal.
Man, after this we've got to find a Morgana so I can work all this food off.
Shouldn't be hard. We're practically Morgana magnets after all.
I know. Aren't we so lucky?
@BATTLE
Kidding, I'm not that horrible.
Ummm, St. Louis, the Morganas are usually coming towards the island. You know, from the sea.
Uh, huh, I'm familiar with the movement patterns of Morganas.
So why are you staring at the islands?
I'm not watching for Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: Then what are you watching for?
Why exactly not?
Do I need to remind you why we're here?

Fields.DialogueText: What do you think? Dragons.
Because while Morganas would be coming from the sea, dragons are far more likely to already be on land.
No. I know why we're here. I'm just multitasking. I can hunt for Morganas and dragons at the same time.
Dragons? Again with the dragons?
Always with the dragons. Until I'm wearing a dragon skin jacket with an awesome, like, fire motif!
All right, tell you what - you hunt one and I'll help you make a jacket out of it.
I like the sound of that. Deal!
But until then, please keep your eyes out for the Morganas, okay?
*raspberry* Fiiiine.
@BATTLE
St. Louis, what are you doing in here?
In the chart room? I spend a lot of time in here. Why do you think this ship sails so smoothly?

Fields.MenuText: Magic?
I have you to thank, probably.
I guess I always took it for granted.

Fields.DialogueText: That's me! I've got a knack for navigating, believe it or not. Always have.
You're figuring it out, Captain!
Well, you shouldn't. Everyone enjoys a thank you every once in a while.
So you can navigate in your sleep, I see.
Besides, the privacy is nice up here every now and then.
And you haven't kicked me out of your hiding spot yet. You don't mind me bothering you here?
Now and then, I like my privacy... but maybe I kinda, um, don't exactly mind having you as a part of that privacy. Is that weird?
Based on our voyage together so far, I decided I'm pretty fond of your weird.
Heh, well, *blush* thanks I guess. You know, hardly anybody else comes up here.
*ALARM*
No matter how well I navigate, there's really no planning for THEM, is there?!
That's what all your guns are for.
@BATTLE
Zzzz... zzzz...
Well, looky who I found in the back corner of the chart room.
Zzzz... *snort* Huh? Captain? Uh...
I looked at our track plan, checked our waypoints and everything - but I got done so fast I thought I'd catch a few winks.
What are you thinking?
Maybe it's a dumb idea, but, maybe we-
*ALARM*
Captain, we are surrounded on all sides by Morganas!
All sides? We're in the harbor! What's going on?
The island is surrounded! It's gotta be like twenty or thirty of 'em!

Fields.MenuText: Too much for you?
We've had worse.
At least it's not a dragon.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess we're about to find out!
Really? When? I can't think of anything.
Oh, man, I wish it was a dragon. That'd be awesome!
*BOOM*
Captain, St. Louis, they're starting to bomb the island.
Are they attacking us too?
It looks like they're focusing on the island.
I guess we better draw a little fire then!
@BATTLE
Captain, Captain, are you seeing this!?
Seeing what? I'm a little busy here!
That Morgana right there, the one spitting out fire right and left! It's a freaking dragon! Can't you see it, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: I'm pretty sure it's Fire, but... yeah, the dragon description actually kinda works.
I just see a wave of Morganas. Dragons can wait.
Looks more like a bull if you ask me.

Fields.DialogueText: Right?! This. Is the. Best day. Ever!
Dragons don't wait. It's not in their nature! We gotta take it out now!
Bulls don't have scales or breathe fire, Captain!
Dragon or not we've still got Morganas to fight, St. Louis!
All right, well let's start with that one then!
Sounds like a plan. I hope you're ready for your dragon scale vest!
@BATTLE
Did that Morgana just breathe fire? It sprayed fire on us!
Put the ship out already, we need water!
We need a little breathing room to recover!
Uh, uh, uh, okay, I got it, Captain, we've got to move exactly as I say, okay?

Fields.MenuText: I'd follow you anywhere, St. Louis.
Are you going to put those navigation skills to good use?
As long as you don't lead us straight into the dragon's mouth.

Fields.DialogueText: Uhhh, there are a couple places I definitely don't want you following me, Captain.
Obviously. If there was ever a time to use them, it'd be now.
Actually we'll be going the opposite way. I don't wanna be dragon food either.
Now, we need to move through the rocks!
The scary looking rocks that look like they're covered in blood?
Just go!
Did you see that? How many Morganas do you think just crashed into those rocks?
Not enough, we've still got some big scary ones on our tail.
At least the fire is out. Let's see if one more strike will slay these dragons.
@BATTLE
Having a well-earned moment of triumph, huh?
That's right, you can all call me St. Louis, the dragon slayer!
All dragons shall fear me!

Fields.MenuText: I shall bow before our fearless leader!
Okay, get off the railings, you're making a scene.
It was a Morgana, not a dragon. You know that, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, please, get up, Captain. You're embarrassing me.
You can't make me. I'll make as many scenes as I want. Hell, I'll make a whole play.
It was a dragon. I don't care what you say.
You really are a lucky charm. We'd be in the water if it wasn't for you, St. Louis.
There's a reason we call her Lucky Lou.
You call me that? I've never heard that!
Lucky Lou... I like it, it fits you.
No, it's St. Louis, the dragon slayer!
I'll call you whatever you want.
You better.
We're not out of the woods yet. There are still some straggling Morganas left.
No need to fear. We're dragon slayers, remember?
I'm the dragon slayer! You're all my squires.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Tally ho, squires!
Sheesh, Captain, can I hide in here in your cabin for a little while?
Um... should I ask?
Everyone keeps calling me Lucky Lou. They won't let it go. It's getting on my last nerve.

Fields.MenuText: You can stay in here as long as you want. My office is your office.
You don't like it? I think it's adorable. The perfect nickname for you.
Want me to talk to them? I can threaten 'em with trash duty.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh really? Then maybe I'll just bring some of my stuff up here. My office could really use some redecorating.
What are you trying to say? You think I'm adorable all of a sudden?
Heh, maybe if they got stuck cleaning up the whole boat they'd start calling me Unlucky Lou.
You know, if you keep saying stuff like that I'm going to start thinking you're sweet on me... Wait... are you?
You mean, do I like you?
Yeah, but like... like-like. Do you like-like me?
Maybe. Do you like-like me?
... Maybe.
Well... Maybe we should discuss these mutual maybes later. Maybe over dinner tonight?
Hmmmm... Okay. But this doesn't mean I'm admitting I like you or anything.
Oh trust me, I wouldn't dream of it.
Well, I mean, you know... I wouldn't stop you from dreaming...
*smile* I'll keep that in mind.
All right, well, I'm going to go back to watching for Morganas... I'll, uh, I'll see you tonight.
I'll see you tonight. And when we eventually run into Morganas.
Yeah... I guess you're right. But, uh... I'm looking more forward to tonight.
Me, too.
Bring whatever you want, as long as you keep your secret crush posters in your room.
I've always thought you were adorable. In fairness though, I've also thought you were annoying sometimes. Still, you're the cutest girl I know.
Nah, I doubt it. You'll always be lucky. At least in my eyes.
*ALARM*
Wait a sec, Captain! Have a little bit of my luck first...
Ok, now let's GO! GO! GO!
*kiss*
